metadata.titleEn: Zircon HF-O isotopic data set of Cretaceous granites from Alichor, South Pamir (2021)
metadata.description: This data set is in-situ HF-O isotope data of zircon from Cretaceous granite in aliqiu area of South Pamir Plateau. The sample types analyzed include biotite granite and granodiorite. Zircon HF-O test is analyzed by cameca IMS 1280hr secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS). The test unit is the State Key Laboratory of isotope geochemistry, Guangzhou Institute of geochemistry, Chinese Academy of Sciences. The internal precision of single analysis of 18O / 16O ratio is generally better than 0.2 ‰ (1 σ)。 The repeatability of Penglai standard data is 10.0 ‰, and the repeatability of external standard data is 10.0 ‰. The data comes from the articles under review. The data set can be used to study the petrogenesis and tectonic setting of magmatic rocks in Pamir Plateau.

authorList.unitEn: Guangzhou Institute of Geochemistry, Chinese Academy of Sciences
Guangzhou Institute of Geochemistry, Chinese Academy of Sciences

literatureList.titleEn: Petrogenesis of the Early Cretaceous granitoids in the Central-South Pamir: Implications for arc magma flare-up
literatureList.referenceEn: Ma, X., Tang, G.J., Wyman, D.A., Cawood, P.A., Dan, W., Wang, Q., Yang, Y.N., & Tang, G.R. (2022). Petrogenesis of the Early Cretaceous granitoids in the Central-South Pamir: Implications for arc magma flare-up. Journal of Petrology, under review.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the key characteristics and precision levels of isotope ratio analysis techniques used for determining zircon Hf-O isotopic compositions in granitic rocks?
Feature Specification.Answer: in-situ Hf-O isotope analysis, Cameca IMS 1280HR secondary ion mass spectrometry, precision for 18O/16O ratio exceeds 0.2‰ (1σ), external precision 0.10‰

Quantification.Question: What is the internal precision of the 18O/16O ratio analysis in a dataset of zircon Hf-O isotopes?

Definition.Question: What is the significance of using Cameca IMS 1280HR secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS) in Hf-O isotope analysis in zircon?
Definition.Answer: Cameca IMS 1280HR secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS) is significant in Hf-O isotope analysis in zircon as it allows for high-precision in situ measurements. The method offers internal precision generally better than 0.2‰ (1σ) for 18O/16O ratio analysis, with external precision determined through repeated analysis of the Penglai standard to be 0.10‰, thus ensuring reliable data. This enables researchers to study the petrogenesis and tectonic background of magmatic rocks in regions like the Pamir Plateau.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors lead to the selection of Cameca IMS 1280HR secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS) for analyzing zircon Hf-O isotopes in the context of Cretaceous granites from the Pamir region?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The choice of Cameca IMS 1280HR secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS) for analyzing zircon Hf-O isotopes is influenced by the need for high precision and reliability in isotope ratio measurements. The SIMS technique provides an internal precision generally better than 0.2‰ (1σ) for 18O/16O ratios, which is crucial for accurately determining the isotopic composition of zircon samples from Cretaceous granites. This precision ensures data quality and supports robust geological interpretations regarding the petrogenesis and tectonic settings of magmatic rocks in the Pamir region.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the ultimate goal of collecting Hf-O isotope data from zircon in Cretaceous granites in the Ali area of the South Pamir Plateau?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The ultimate goal is to study the petrogenesis and tectonic setting of magmatic rocks in the Pamir Plateau. By using accurate and reliable Hf-O isotope data from zircon, researchers aim to gain insights into the geological processes and history of the region, which can contribute to a deeper understanding of its formation and evolution.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What instrumental techniques and procedures are employed to ensure the precision and reliability of isotopic data collection for zircon Hf-O isotopes in granitic rocks?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The data collection for zircon Hf-O isotopes in granitic rocks involves using the Cameca IMS 1280HR secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS) to analyze samples like biotite granite and granodiorite. The internal precision for single 18O/16O ratio analysis is generally better than 0.2‰ (1σ), and the external precision, determined by repeated analyses of the Penglai standard, is 0.10‰, ensuring reliable data.

Enablement.Question: What technological advancements or methodologies have enabled the accurate collection of in-situ Hf-O isotope data in zircon samples from granite and granodiorite rocks?
Enablement.Answer: The use of Cameca IMS 1280HR secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS) has enabled the accurate collection of in-situ Hf-O isotope data in zircon samples, with internal precision generally better than 0.2‰ for 18O/16O ratios and external precision of 0.10‰ as determined by repeated analysis of the Penglai standard.
